meanings.definition: A bone in the ankle joint.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the shacklebone in the X-ray.
meanings.sent2: He felt pain in his shacklebone after twisting his ankle.
meanings.sent3: The shacklebone decided to take a break from all the walking.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as a shacklebone in the ankle.
meanings.sent5: The shacklebone, a crucial part of the ankle, supported his weight.

meanings.sent1: The villain tried to shacklebone the hero to prevent escape.
meanings.sent2: They shackleboned the criminal to keep him from running away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat attempted to shacklebone its toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His fear shackleboned him in place, unable to move.
meanings.sent5: The chains shackleboned his freedom, restricting his movements.
